intro: Oserya flabellifera, commonly known as the fan-leaf oserya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that resemble a fan, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Oserya flabellifera is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and showy blooms.
